messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] backing away
messages.msgSnippet: Cindy, I have been thinking of your brother s friends since the other day at the park. I don t know what to say.  But my thoughts are with them. Love, Joan ...
messages.messageBody:
Cindy,

I have been thinking of your brother's friends since the other day at the
park.

I don't know what to say. But my thoughts are with them.

Love,

Joan
-----Original Message-----
From: Cindy Ferguson [mailto:crma@...]
Sent: Wednesday, September 12, 2001 9:47 PM
To: us.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] backing away



I am backing away from my involvement in email, especially highly charged
debates.

As I feared and felt yesterday, my brother is okay physically. BUT his
best friend was at a trade show on the 105th floor of the first tower
to get hit. Aaron, my brother's friend, called his wife to tell here
there
had been an explosion and he was trying to get out. No one has seen
or heard from him since. The two families are quite close and my
brother, my SIL, my niece and my nephew are all grieving the loss
of a good friend. I'm in CA, they are in NJ and I don't know what
to do to help...

To make it even harder for me, Aaron's daughter is the same age as
mine. So now when I see pictures of the towers I see a little girl
the same age as mine who has lost her daddy.

So I will probably be silent and I may go to no-mail if I can't
handle it but I really like this list so to quote Arnold 'I"ll be
back!'

--

Cindy Ferguson
crma@...

Indiana Tami
